bug.short_desc: Slider's vertical orientation is "backwards" for many applications

long_desc.thetext:
The vertical orientation of the Slider produces the minimum value at the top of movement, and the maximum value at the bottom of movement. This is backwards for many applications. Consider a volume control slider or a power control slider. The intuitive operation would be to move the slider UP to increase the volume or increase the power, DOWN to decrease it.
Attempts to set the "minimum" property to the higher value and the "maximum" property to the lower value results in an error.
I suggest that in addition to an "orientation" property, there also be a "direction" property that determines whether the minimum values it to the top/left (as it is currently) or at the bottom/right.
Derrell

Thanks for the report Derrell. Would't it be enough that the developer can set a start value and a end value. This no information about orientation and direction and could be configured for all use cases as desired.
